desc_content.paragraph: Bases: ModelViewSet
Views to get, create and update Library Collections.
Create a Collection that belongs to a Content Library
Soft-deletes a Collection that belongs to a Content Library
Returns the requested ContentLibrary object, if access allows.
Returns the requested Collections, if access allows.
This method may raise exceptions; these are handled by the @convert_exceptions wrapper on the views.
Returns a queryset for the requested Collections, if access allows.
This method may raise exceptions; these are handled by the @convert_exceptions wrapper on the views.
List Collections that belong to Content Library
Update a Collection that belongs to a Content Library
Restores a soft-deleted Collection that belongs to a Content Library
Retrieve the Content Library Collection
alias of ContentLibraryCollectionSerializer
Adds (PATCH) or removes (DELETE) items to/from a Collection.
Collection and items must all be part of the given library/learning package.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.content_libraries.rest_api.containers module
section.paragraph: REST API views for containers (sections, subsections, units) in content libraries

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: GenericAPIView
View to get or update children of specific container (a section, subsection, or unit)

Remove components from unit Example: DELETE /api/libraries/v2/containers/<container_key>/children/ Request body: {“usage_keys”: [‘lb:CL-TEST:containers:problem:Problem1’, ‘lb:CL-TEST:containers:html:Html1’]}
.dispatch() is pretty much the same as Django’s regular dispatch, but with extra hooks for startup, finalize, and exception handling.
Get children components of given container Example: GET /api/libraries/v2/containers/<container_key>/children/ Result: [

definition.paragraph: ‘block_type’: ‘problem’, ‘can_stand_alone’: True, ‘collections’: [], ‘created’: ‘2025-03-21T13:53:55Z’, ‘def_key’: None, ‘display_name’: ‘Blank Problem’, ‘has_unpublished_changes’: True, ‘id’: ‘lb:CL-TEST:containers:problem:Problem1’, ‘last_draft_created’: ‘2025-03-21T13:53:55Z’, ‘last_draft_created_by’: ‘Bob’, ‘last_published’: None, ‘modified’: ‘2025-03-21T13:53:55Z’, ‘published_by’: None,

desc_content.paragraph: Replace components in unit, can be used to reorder components as well. Example: PATCH /api/libraries/v2/containers/<container_key>/children/ Request body: {“usage_keys”: [‘lb:CL-TEST:containers:problem:Problem1’, ‘lb:CL-TEST:containers:html:Html1’]}

Add components to unit Example: POST /api/libraries/v2/containers/<container_key>/children/ Request body: {“usage_keys”: [‘lb:CL-TEST:containers:problem:Problem1’, ‘lb:CL-TEST:containers:html:Html1’]}
alias of LibraryXBlockMetadataSerializer

View to set collections for a container.
.dispatch() is pretty much the same as Django’s regular dispatch, but with extra hooks for startup, finalize, and exception handling.
Sets Collections for a Component.
Collection and Components must all be part of the given library/learning package.

.dispatch() is pretty much the same as Django’s regular dispatch, but with extra hooks for startup, finalize, and exception handling.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.content_libraries.rest_api.utils module
section.paragraph: REST API utilities for content libraries

desc_content.paragraph: Catch any Content Library API exceptions that occur and convert them to DRF exceptions so DRF will return an appropriate HTTP response
